ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Moving’s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

name: A Little to the Left: Drawers

editorialNotes.standard: Neatly arranging fountain pens and acrylic paints not only declutters drawers and cupboards but also soothes our minds.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: A Dance of Fire and Ice
A Little to the Left: Stars

editorialNotes.standard: Use curious elevators to cross beautiful buildings in a puzzler that’s as stylish as it is confounding.
Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.
Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

ios.subtitle: Take It To The Next Level

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The game’s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TV—we feel like we’re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: In Hello Games' side-scrolling racer, you control the eponymous stunt devil as he jumps, wheelies, and backflips through a huge assortment of death-defying levels. With tricks to master, costumes to unlock, and leaderboards to conquer, Joe Danger is a wacky blast. You’ll don an Elvis getup, evade flying saucers, and soar over shark tanks in increasingly treacherous tracks. After all, they don’t call him Joe Danger for nothing.

Unleash your inner daredevil with Hello Games’ electrifying new racing game, a fast-paced side-scroller bursting with fun challenges. As miniature stuntman Joe Danger and his crew of wacky drivers, you’ll pop wheelies, sail off ramps, and even repel missiles and UFOs, snagging collectibles as you go for maximum points. With responsive controls and colorful stages, it'll hook anyone who appreciates an action-packed joyride.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Are aliens really out there? Discover the truth by rummaging through crop circles, pizza trucks, and more in this interactive hidden-object game.

This clever physics-based puzzle game challenges you to spray water to extinguish fires and manipulate the environment. Its simple, clearly defined mechanics allow for intuitive, satisfying puzzle-solving. New elements are routinely layered in, ensuring that the challenges stay interesting. Great visuals and impressive sound also set Sprinkle Islands apart.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A talking goat ate your grimoire! Relearn recipes by collecting reagents and tricking folks in this bewitchingly fun fairy tale.
With relaxed swapping rules and charming graphics, this surprisingly slick match-3 puzzler makes the genre feel fresh again.

name: Super Phantom Cat - Be a jumping bro.

editorialNotes.standard: With its endearing art style and Mario-esque gameplay, this platformer had us purring in no time. Each cleverly devised level holds scores of hidden pickups and cute-but-lethal foes to dodge or pounce on. Robots fling you to high-up areas, fireball power-ups let you shoot obstacles, and funny messages fill the Phantom World with quirky appeal.

Zipping down snowy hills, trying to stay ahead of a massive avalanche—the pressure’s always on in this infinite-racing classic. And we love that whirlwind pace, fueled by landing backflips and hitching rides on penguins, snowmobiles, and yetis. From the game’s masterful one-touch controls to its cheery music, every aspect feels perfectly tuned to keep you playing through long afternoons and late nights.
Peek under roofs and rummage through spaceships to track down objects in this delightful time-hopping puzzler.

One of the App Store’s early sensations, Doodle Jump HD has only improved with age. The superbly simple gameplay remains: tilt your device to hop up an endless series of platforms, blasting bad guys, grabbing power-ups, and making your mark on a global leaderboard. Hand-drawn visuals add quirky appeal, while an evolving mix of doodled worlds, special items, and whimsical characters keep this indie classic fresh.

Packing tons of great vehicles and multiple ways to play, Mini Motor Racing hits the sweet spot between frantic arcade driving and the depth of realistic racers. The look is cute yet richly detailed, with luscious lighting and environmental effects across a variety of tracks and terrains. Win cash to upgrade your ride in the lengthy career mode, or hit the quickplay and multiplayer circuits for a spin around the block. However you roll, flexible steering options let you drive with precision for a great time behind the wheel.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: Jumpgrid
artistName: Shape Shop Pty Ltd atf Shape Shop Trust

editorialNotes.standard: With surreal illustrations and fruit-headed characters, this point-and-click adventure is as strange as it is clever.

Developer Jan Ilavsky came up with the idea for this gorgeous Apple Design Award winner after he’d broken his arm. He started on an infinite runner that could be played one-handed, and since he’s also colorblind, he added a gameplay element about changing between vibrant neon colors. Chameleon Run succeeds beautifully, balancing wicked speed with irresistible, just-one-more-try challenges.
editorialNotes.short: You'll need quick reactions in this intense polychromatic platformer.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Ski Safari returns with an all-new look and the same addicting gameplay. Now you can hit the slopes as Sven's sister, Evana, boot up with a snowboard, and unlock all sorts of new power-ups. To outrun an impending avalanche you’ll need to crash through cabins, team up with Yetis and eagles, and perform tons of tricks. The gameplay is as fast-paced as ever, and a fresh multiplayer mode and colorful new worlds to explore (like a prehistoric volcano) will keep you cruising down these mountains for a long time.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Railbound’s tough puzzles are brilliantly focused. You’re given only a handful of rail tiles to guide train cars to the correct destinations in the correct order, and yet even with limited options the potential solutions feel limitless. Do you lay track so Car 4 goes through a tunnel and waits at a crossing gate for Cars 2 and 3 to pass? Do you create loops to delay Car 2? Do you ignore the crossing gate altogether? Few games make success feel like it’s always just within reach, even when it isn’t. A helpful hint system keeps the difficulty from going completely off the rails.

name: Ridiculous Fishing - A Tale of Redemption

editorialNotes.short: This amazing arcade game reeled us in and wouldn't let go.
editorialNotes.standard: Classic 8-bit style meshes with innovative and modern gameplay in this downright irresistible fishing game. A product of some of the best minds in iOS design, these App Store all-stars deliver a unique and twisted take on fishing that had us feverishly tilting, tapping, and swiping to catch and blast hundreds of fish. With gorgeously raw visuals, delightful music, and loads of unlockables, Ridiculous Fishing is truly remarkable.
